beachsites.name: Big City Resort
beachsites.description: This Big City Resort caters to travelers seeking more from a beach stay-cation than just sunbathing... Restaurants, Shopping Malls, Spas, and Wellness Centers. You want it, We have it!

beachsites.name: White Villa Resort
beachsites.description: Situated at a stunning hillside location with breath-taking mountain views, you will feel at home in these villas.

beachsites.name: Paradise island
beachsites.description: Running low on inspiration... Not any more! This Island cures burnout.

beachsites.name: Beach Bungalows
beachsites.description: Afraid of the water? Just stay on the beach.

beachsites.name: Water Bungalows
beachsites.description: Afraid of the beach? Just stay on the water.

beachsites.name: Survivor Island
beachsites.description: Internet, ✓ Solar, ✓ now all you need is to beat the others on the island before your deadline!

comments.text: The water was clean and clear, and there were plenty of activities for me to do on the beach: swimming, surfing, reading a book, playing volleyball… the list goes on.
comments.author: Laxman Sashka

comments.text: This crazy monkey kept following us back to our resort.
comments.author: Marita Idir

comments.text: Do not drink the seawater. It isn't as clean as you would think.
comments.author: Philip Joby

comments.text: Don't forget to bring suntan lotion... This is my first time taking a vacation, nobody told me that the office and beach had different lighting!
comments.author: Lizzie Ruzan

comments.text: This has been our favorite cresort for over 7 years. It is an absolutely beautiful site. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Don't forget to try out the pool.
comments.author: R. E. Lucas

comments.text: Wow..Just wow... I think I will stay for another year. The villas are so beautiful and everything I need is close by.
comments.author: Lily Tatianna

comments.text: If you're looking for an opportunity to reconnect with friends and family while getting some sun and exercise in nature, I would highly recommend working from your own backyard!
comments.author: Ted Downs

comments.text: The villas were nice, but I felt like they were a little too big. It would be better to come with others.
comments.author: Jayne McLaughlin

comments.text: The villas a excellent, but I found the beach to be a bit boring after a few weeks.
comments.author: Darlene Simon

comments.text: It's so relaxing and peaceful. I feel like I'm in my own little bubble of calm, and everyone else is just kind of like a part of the scenery. There are no distractions, just waves and birds and sunsets. It's amazing how much peace you can find on a beach!
comments.author: Stuart Lozano

comments.text: I had a great time working from an island. It was so nice to have the freedom to get up early, take a walk around the island, or go for a run. The weather was also really lovely, as we had sunshine almost every day.
comments.author: Maurice Wilkerson

comments.text: We had a family emergency and had to leave the island, but the was no way off until morning! Think about emergencies, please!
comments.author: John and Rene Peterson

comments.text: I would recommend working from an island if you want to be able to do your job while still being able to enjoy nature and relax when you need it. It's a great balance between getting outside and being productive!
comments.author: Joann Foley

comments.text: It was a great place to work, but it was a bit isolated... I had some trouble getting things I need for my diet
comments.author: Kenneth Brown

comments.text: Working from an island is a dream come true. I love the seclusion, but I also love the ability to be in touch with the outside world and have access to so many resources. It's really nice to have access to people who can help me figure out if I need something shipped.
comments.author: Sonia Osborne

comments.text: It was great, but being here made it a little difficult to feel motivated to work.
comments.author: Merle Jensen

comments.text: I love working from the beach.
comments.author: Lori Ware

comments.text: I would definitely recommend working from the beach if you're looking for a change of pace from your regular office routine.
comments.author: Kirk McCann

comments.text: I love working from a beach bungalow. The atmosphere is relaxed and laid back, which is perfect for me. I can't imagine having to work in an office all day long, but I also don't want to feel like I'm missing out on anything either. A beach bungalow is the perfect balance of relaxed and productive—and it's exactly what I need!
comments.author: Jay Roth

comments.text: We had a blast working from the beach bungalow!.
comments.author: Tom Tomas
Tim R
comments.text: Great!!!

comments.author: Mad person
comments.text: Not Great!

partners.name: Nomad Swag
partners.description: From work clothes to beach bum, we got you covered. Come and visit our total destination selection. If you outgrow it, we will even offer a refund!

partners.name: Booking Now
partners.description: Join our master booking team to explore new horizons with a group of your coworkers!

partners.name: Tech Expo
partners.description: You need tech, we got tech! Serving the work-from-home movement from 2019. office furniture, computers, snack machines, heated socks, and even headphones.

partners.name: Lack Insurance
partners.description: Lacking insurance, or at least good insurance. Don't worry, we will pay for what your employer won't. Scurvy, Montezuma's Revenge, Nuclear fallout. We got you covered.

promotions.name: Stay-cation Cruise
promotions.description: Book a 4-week stay-cation on one of our beautiful yachts, fully equipped for your work needs! enjoy the views of the ocean while you crunch your numbers.

promotions.name: Half-way Meditation
promotions.description: Imagine half a day living like a monk and the other like an executive... peaceful!...
